summary: SURIGAO CITY, Surigao del Norte — A massive fire tore through residential areas along Nueva Street and P. According to the Bureau of Fire Protection (BFP), the fire started at 4:31 p.m. and was declared under control at 7:29 p.m. Initial assessments show that 139 families, or 519 individuals, lost their homes. The affected residents were mainly from Purok Camia and Purok Diamond, two densely populated areas. title: AFP, PNP, PCG conclude first joint drills on ‘co-equal’ operations
summary: MANILA, Philippines — The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP), the Philippine National Police (PNP) and the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Wednesday concluded their first interagency tabletop exercise. AFP chief of staff Gen. Romeo Brawner Jr. said the exercise was a pilot run that marks a shift in how the country’s security forces train and operate together. Unlike previous joint activities where one agency typically took the lead, the inaugural Interagency Exercise (IAX) placed the AFP, PNP and PCG on “co-equal footing,” an approach Brawner said is now necessary as the Philippines confronts overlapping internal, maritime and multidomain threats. title: Coast guard seizes P8-M smuggled cigarettes in Sulu waters

Authorities reported that upon boarding and inspection, the team found that the vessel and its cargo were operating without the required documents and were not displaying the markings mandated under the government’s Safety, Security, and Environmental Numbering System. title: BFAR: Red tide up in Surigao del Sur's Lianga Bay, 4 other areas
summary: TANDAG CITY, Surigao del Sur – The Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (BFAR) has alerted the public that Lianga Bay in Surigao del Sur province is among several bays in the country that are contaminated with paralytic shellfish poison (PSP), based on Shellfish Bulletin No. 24, which it released on November 28. Shellfish samples collected from Dumanquillas Bay in Zamboanga del Sur, Tantanang Bay in Zamboanga Sibugay, the coastal waters of Zumarraga Island in Samar, Matarinao Bay in Eastern Samar, and Lianga Bay in Surigao del Sur continue to test above the regulatory limit for toxic red tide. title: Laguindingan Airport maintenance, repair works done
summary: CAGAYAN DE ORO CITY — Travelers passing through the Laguindingan International Airport (LIA), the primary gateway to Northern Mindanao, can expect smoother operations following the completion of critical infrastructure improvements by its new private operator.
